headline: Oracle price target raised to $200 from $190 at Evercore ISI
summary: Evercore ISI analyst Kirk Materne raised the firm’s price target on Oracle (ORCL) to $200 from $190 and keeps an Outperform rating on the shares after the company delivered “solid” fiscal Q2 results. The firm believes the pullback in the shares “has a lot more to do with some profit taking after a big move in the shares” year-to-date any real change in the outlook when thinking out to calendar year 2025, the analyst tells investors. headline: Oracle price target raised to $210 from $185 at Mizuho
summary: Mizuho raised the firm’s price target on Oracle (ORCL) to $210 from $185 and keeps an Outperform rating on the shares post the fiscal Q2 report. The cloud infrastructure business remained robust and Oracle’s broad portfolio of infrastructure and application products, its multi-cloud strategy through hyperscaler partnerships, and “unprecedented AI demand position it well to reaccelerate growth,” the analyst tells investors in a research note. headline: ARCO Streamlines Construction Payments with Oracle Textura
summary: ARCO, a leading national design-build construction firm, has implemented Oracle Textura Payment Management to streamline and automate its construction payment processes. With Textura, ARCO has transformed the speed and efficiency of its invoicing, improved the secure management of lien waivers and compliance, and enhanced its collaboration with subcontractors.
